page.title: 05LIVESTOCK FARMING, KIRKCALDY
page.content: Although the greatest emphasis in this area is the cultivation of barley, there is also considerable livestock farming. There is relatively little rough grazing land here , but a considerable acreage is sown under grass for grazing beef and dairy cattle. The main breed of dairy cattle found in the area is the{Friesian,}with a few{Ayrshires}and a selection of {Friesian crosses.}There is also a growing number of{Charolais}bulls and cows being kept in south Fife. These cattle, first introduced to Britain in 1961, are being kept in their own right and also for cross breeding with Friesian cows to produce more 'efficient' cattle. There are no sheep currently kept in this block.
